title: David Beckham builds cask as he visits home of whisky brand Haig Club
text:
Earlier this month, he took to Instagram to document his trip to the breathtaking east coast of Scotland as he revisited the home of his whisky brand, Haig Club.

And David Beckham, 44, has unveiled a detailed recap of his trip to Cambus Cooperage, where the casks of his single grain Scotch are made, to experience first-hand all of the work that goes into the brand and learn about its rich history.

In a video released on Monday, the retired footballer is seen displaying his handiwork, as he's taught to build one of the casks that will house his whisky.

Scroll down for video

Back to where it all started: David Beckham has unveiled footage of himself visiting the Scottish home of his whisky brand Haig Club

Speaking of his experience in Scotland, the star said: 'It was so inspiring to be back in Scotland and to reconnect with the team who create our whisky everyday.

'I have so much respect for their knowledge and expertise and I feel so proud of how far we’ve taken Haig Club since we launched.

'I’ve loved coming back and meeting some of the incredible mixologists who have created original cocktails for us and to see Cambus Cooperage was really inspiring.'

Handiwork: In a video released on Monday, the retired footballer is seen displaying his handiwork, as he's taught to build one of the casks that will house his whisky

Enthusiastic: The sportsman embraces the task with aplomb as he's given a step-by-step guide

Information: The star made the trip to Scotland to learn more about the work behind the brand

Inspired: Speaking of his experience in Scotland, David said, 'It was so inspiring to be back in Scotland and to reconnect with the team who create our whisky everyday'

The trip culminated in a beach dinner party of modern Scottish cuisine catered by Mac and Wild, with Lilah Parsons serving as the DJ.

East London native David took to Instagram to document the festivities as he feasted in the idyllic rustic location.

Revellers were treated to scallops, shrimp, salmon, haggis and steak for the intimate event which was hosted inside a huge yurt.

And in keeping with the truly Scottish theme, the beach party included bagpipe players to entertain the crowd while dining.

Proud: Acknowledging the team's work, he said, 'I have so much respect for their knowledge and expertise and I feel so proud of how far we’ve taken Haig Club since we launched'

All the details: He listened keenly as he was talked through all of the work involved in the brand

Details: Haig Club is created from liquid sourced from the Cameronbridge distillery and is comprised of a variety of aged whisky from three types of cask

Launched: David launched the drink with Diageo and music mogul Simon Fuller back in 2014

Deals: Since retiring from football, he has further built his brand with an array of business deals

Earlier in the day, David visited Fife to take a look at the Haig Club whisky distillery and the hundreds of barrels.

The bash proves Haig Club – a single grain, no-age-statement Scotch whisky – to be expanding all over the world, after David launched the drink with Diageo and music mogul Simon Fuller back in 2014.

The product is created from liquid sourced from the Cameronbridge distillery and is comprised of a variety of aged whisky from three types of cask: first-fill, rejuvenated and refill Bourbon barrels.

In the mix: As part of his educational trip, he also travelled to Glasgow to meet with mixologists

Don't mind if I do! Throughout the video, the British celebrity is seen enjoying drams of scotch

Social media: Since partnering on the brand, David has often promoted it on his social media

Impressed: 'I’ve loved coming back and meeting some of the incredible mixologists who have created original cocktails for us and to see Cambus Cooperage was really inspiring,' David said

Meeting the full team: He sat down with a host of individuals who work with the whisky brand

Fine art connoisseur: As well as branching out into whisky, he has also become a fan of fine art

David said of his involvement in 2017: 'There are many reasons why I wanted to partner Diageo on HAIG CLUB and one of them is their commitment to responsible drinking.'

Discussing his decision to work with whisky, the erstwhile Manchester United ace later explained his tastes were changing now he is in his forties.

He told the Telegraph: 'I am starting to enjoy whisky and have done for the last few years. This is a natural movement - but there has had to be a movement.'

It comes after David recently revealed he insists on instilling work ethic in his children, telling them: 'You'll never get anywhere without making sacrifices.'

Cheers: His trip culminated in a lavish beach party on the breathtaking east coast of Scotland

Dapper gent: Ever the fashion conscious star, the father-of-four stepped out in dapper style

Location, location: The isolated, unspoiled setting proved to be ideal for the intimate gathering

On camera: A full crew was on hand to capture all of the action at the celebratory gathering

Venture: While he rose to fame as a footballer, David has long had his hand in other businesses

Upbeat: The former Manchester United ace appeared to be in an upbeat mood at the gathering

Asked what advice he gives Brooklyn, 20, Romeo, 17, Cruz, 14, and Harper, eight, the former England captain told GQ magazine: 'To work hard, simple as that.'

Brooklyn is an aspiring photographer, and Cruz is said to want to be a pop star like his mother Victoria.

David added: 'I tell the kids they have to make choices, sometimes give things up. If your friends are going out on a Friday night, maybe you can't.

'Maybe you've got tennis practice the next day or you're in the studio singing, like Cruz, or you've got a shoot, like Brooklyn. That's where your focus needs to be.'

Busy: While David is a businessman, his wife Victoria has launched a successful clothing brand

Legacy: Haig Club enjoys a 400-year legacy of master distillers, innovation and tradition

Foodie: David proved he's a total foodie earlier this month as he hosted the beach dinner party with Mac and Wild to promote his Haig Club whisky

Yum: He took to Instagram to document the festivities and feasting in the idyllic rustic location
